title: HLA-C*05:01 and HLA-C*07:02 from 721.221 cells
projectDescription: HLA-C expresion varies widely across the different HLA-C alleles. MicroRNA binding can partly explain the differences in HLA-C allele expression however other contributing factors still remain undetermined. Here we use two common HLA-C alleles, HLA-C*05:01 and HLA-C*07:02, to explore differences in expression levels. Using functional, structural and peptide repertoire comparisons we demonstrate that HLA-C expression levels are not only modulated at the RNA level but also at the protein level. This dataset contains RAW data and database search results for HLA-C*05:01 and HLA-C*07:02 from the 721.221 cell line.
sampleProcessingProtocol: HLA Class I deficient 721.221 transfected to express either HLA-C*05:01 or HLA-C*07:02 were lysed by using detergent (IGEPAL). HLA were purified by W6/32 antibody affinity followed and peptides seperated by reversed-phase HPLC. Fractipons were pooled and analysed with a a Q Exactive Hybrid Quadrupole-Orbitrap Mass Spectrometer (Thermo Scientific).
dataProcessingProtocol: The raw output files were converted to mgf using msconvert (ProteoWizard) and peptides searched with ProteinPilot V5.0 (SCIEX) with the the human UniProtKB/SwissProt database (Feb2016).
